title: heaptrack make test failed 1.1.0 in  and No tests were found in 1.2.0

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install -v --keep-stage heaptrack@1.1.0
$ spack cd heaptrack@1.1.0 && cd ../spack-build-ommfyyo && make test
```
```
Running tests...
/home/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-aarch64/gcc-8.3.1/cmake-3.19.5-re6ussdvvkyy3soxi5csngz6ctdhc3l5/bin/ctest --force-new-ctest-process
Test project /tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-heaptrack-1.1.0-ommfyyonpjmcmwncdwmjuswbnqf4sgfn/spack-build-ommfyyo
    Start 1: tst_trace
1/4 Test #1: tst_trace ........................   Passed    0.01 sec
    Start 2: tst_libheaptrack
2/4 Test #2: tst_libheaptrack .................   Passed    0.91 sec
    Start 3: tst_io
3/4 Test #3: tst_io ...........................   Passed    0.08 sec
    Start 4: tst_inject
4/4 Test #4: tst_inject .......................***Failed    0.01 sec

75% tests passed, 1 tests failed out of 4

Total Test time (real) =   1.01 sec

The following tests FAILED:
          4 - tst_inject (Failed)
Errors while running CTest
make: *** [Makefile:117: test] Error 8
```
```console
$ vim /Testing/Temporary/LastTest.log
```
```
3/4 Testing: tst_io
3/4 Test: tst_io
Command: "/tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-heaptrack-1.1.0-ommfyyonpjmcmwncdwmjuswbnqf4sgfn/spack-build-ommfyyo/tests/auto/tst_io"
Directory: /tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-heaptrack-1.1.0-ommfyyonpjmcmwncdwmjuswbnqf4sgfn/spack-build-ommfyyo/tests/auto
"tst_io" start time: Mar 15 15:48 CST
Output:
----------------------------------------------------------

<end of output>

----------------------------------------------------------

"tst_io" end time: Mar 15 15:48 CST
"tst_io" time elapsed: 00:00:00
----------------------------------------------------------

4/4 Testing: tst_inject

Directory: /tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-heaptrack-1.1.0-ommfyyonpjmcmwncdwmjuswbnqf4sgfn/spack-build-ommfyyo/tests/auto
"tst_inject" start time: Mar 15 15:48 CST
Output:
----------------------------------------------------------

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
tst_inject is a Catch v1.2.1 host application.
Run with -? for options

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
inject via dlopen
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-heaptrack-1.1.0-ommfyyonpjmcmwncdwmjuswbnqf4sgfn/spack-src/tests/auto/tst_inject.cpp:87
...............................................................................

/tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-heaptrack-1.1.0-ommfyyonpjmcmwncdwmjuswbnqf4sgfn/spack-src/tests/auto/tst_inject.cpp:87: FAILED:
  {Unknown expression after the reported line}
due to a fatal error condition:

<end of output>

"tst_inject" end time: Mar 15 15:48 CST

End testing: Mar 15 15:48 CS
```
@simo-tuomisto   Compile and install version 1.1.0 for make test test, and report the error as above，I found that the official version released 1.2.0, so I tried to compile and install and tested, reported an error and did not find the test case, why did this happen? I don't have the authority to ask questions on the official website. Can I give you some help?
```console
$ spack install -v --keep-stage heaptrack@1.2.0
$ spack cd heaptrack@1.2.0 && cd ../spack-build-yppt2vu && make test
```
```
Running tests...
/home/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-aarch64/gcc-8.3.1/cmake-3.19.5-re6ussdvvkyy3soxi5csngz6ctdhc3l5/bin/ctest --force-new-ctest-process
Test project /tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-heaptrack-1.2.0-yppt2vukik2cbqk6zrpzsku7kln4wbqc/spack-build-yppt2vu/tests
No tests were found!!!
```
### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->
```console
$ spack debug report
```
```
* **Spack:** 0.16.0-1376-f65e6ae4e6
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos8-aarch64
* **Concretizer:** original
```
### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

<!-- We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively!

If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.

Other than that, thanks for taking the time to contribute to Spack! -->
